Key Match Events: Jason Holder took 4-7 as England were bowled out for 103
Brandon King hit an unbeaten 52 as West Indies won with 17 balls to spare
Post-Match Reflections: Eoin Morgan: 'West Indies dominated the game early on. We lost early wickets, we didn't seem to adapt well enough in running, which is what you have to do when challenged like that with movement and a bit of bounce.'
Kieron Pollard: 'That's the blueprint we ask guys to put up. Really happy for the guys. To come out and win a match isn't easy, to see the young guys come out and finish it off was fantastic.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: England quickly found themselves in trouble as Holder and Sheldon Cottrell did damage with the new ball
Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid provided resistance but were eventually dismissed
West Indies' pitch selection and bowling tactics proved effective against England
The match was played in Barbados
